visualization_prompt: Generate a polar column chart showing monthly photovoltaic efficiency percentages using synthetic temperature-correlated data with dynamic tooltip formatting
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 univariate measurements of photovoltaic efficiency percentages. Synthetic values (μ=19.1%, σ=2.0) follow an inverse temperature relationship with seasonal adjustments, simulating real-world semiconductor behavior. Data was generated using a negative quadratic correlation (R²=0.92) with embedded ±0.5% random measurement error. The polar coordinate system emphasizes annual cyclicity while the inverted columns create radial bars that maintain proportional area perception. Cool-toned crosshairs (ΔE=8.7 in CIELAB) provide non-competing reference lines, adhering to Cairo's pre-attentive processing principles. Efficiency ranges (15-22.5%) reflect realistic mono-Si PV performance degradation patterns, with July's peak (22.3%) demonstrating the temperature-efficiency paradox through synthetic thermal modeling (β=-0.38%/°C).
